result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamont Dwayne Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO ALL COUNTS:  Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay wil result in a civil judgment.  All court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All appplicable fees of supervision.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts two and three; but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for five days.

superMiscConds.notes: Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.
*Conditions apply to all counts/this case.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one and three, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for five days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one and two; but consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for five days.

Original Transcript (29 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing NOVEMBER 9, 2015 received and filed.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant Lamont Dwayne Jackson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Lamont Dwayne Jackson in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Bobby P.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS with 5 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 2 & 3, but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 5 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 1 & 3, but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS with 5 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 2 & 1, but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Letter in Support of the Defendant

 Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Lamont Dwayne Jackson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Lamont Dwayne Jackson in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
As to Counts 1, 2 & 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lamont Dwayne Jackson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 10/5/2015 is converted to a plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
At the request of defense and without objection from the court and state final pre-trial moved from 8:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m.
